result.execSummary:
The defendant Sean M Handrick Oberle was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 4th Degree Sexual Assault, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.225(3m).
  • 4th Degree Sexual Assault, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.225(3m).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: From Court to defendant denying request

Waukesha County Jail Inmate Communication Form dated 9/20/16 requesting sentence modification.

The Court has reviewed the Defendant's pro se request to add release for childcare to his Huber privileges.  The Court denies this request as not in the interests of justice.
From Court to defendant denying request to modify sentence.
Waukesha County Jail Inmate Communication Form dated 8/23/16 requesting sentence modification.

The Court has reviewed the defendant's pro se correspondence.  There is no information as to the nature of the surgery, whether it is elective or not, or whether the surgery could be done after the Huber sentence is completed.  Without this additional information, the Court is unable to evaluate the defendant's request and therefore denies it at this time.
Waukesha County Jail Inmate Communication Form with attached letter, received on 08/12/16, requesting stay of sentence due to planned surgery.   Sent to Judge Maxwell for review.
Reference letters

Defendant Sean M Handrick Oberle in court with attorney Mark A. Pecora.  Ted Szczupakiewicz appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case called for sentencing hearing. State presents arguments. Defense presents arguments. Court imposed the following sentence:

Ct. 1 - 9 months huber for work. Sentence to commence 06/20/2016 by 06:00 pm. 

Ct. 2 - 9 months jail consecutive. Sentence STAYED and placed on probation for 18 months

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
AODA treatment
No contact with the victim or her family
No unsupervised contact with  anyone under 18 years old, except for his own children
Sex Offender counseling or any other treatment deemed approiate by his agent 
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;

COURT COSTS:  $243.00 on each count  (to be paid as a condition of probation);

DNA SURCHARGE:  $200.00 on each count (to be paid as a condition of probation);
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.
